trans-unit.source: Configure DNS between two Azure virtual networks | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Configure DNS between two Azure virtual networks | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure VPN connections and domain name resolution between two virtual networks, and how to configure HBase geo-replication.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure VPN connections and domain name resolution between two virtual networks, and how to configure HBase geo-replication.

trans-unit.source: Configure DNS between two Azure virtual networks
trans-unit.target: Configure DNS between two Azure virtual networks

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Configure VPN connectivity
trans-unit.target: Configure VPN connectivity

trans-unit.source: Configure DNS
trans-unit.target: Configure DNS

trans-unit.source: Configure HBase replication
trans-unit.target: Configure HBase replication

trans-unit.source: Learn how to add and configure DNS servers to Azure virtual networks to handle name resolution within and across the virtual networks.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to add and configure DNS servers to Azure virtual networks to handle name resolution within and across the virtual networks.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is the second part of the [series][hdinsight-hbase-geo-replication] on creating HBase geo-replication:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is the second part of the [series][hdinsight-hbase-geo-replication] on creating HBase geo-replication:

trans-unit.source: Configure a VPN connectivity between two virtual networks
trans-unit.target: Configure a VPN connectivity between two virtual networks

trans-unit.source: Configure DNS for the virtual networks (this tutorial)
trans-unit.target: Configure DNS for the virtual networks (this tutorial)

trans-unit.source: Configure HBase geo replication
trans-unit.target: Configure HBase geo replication

trans-unit.source: The following diagram illustrates the two virtual networks you created in [Configure a VPN connectivity between two virtual networks][hdinsight-hbase-geo-replication-vnet]:
trans-unit.target: The following diagram illustrates the two virtual networks you created in [Configure a VPN connectivity between two virtual networks][hdinsight-hbase-geo-replication-vnet]:

trans-unit.source: HDInsight HBase replication virtual network diagram
trans-unit.target: HDInsight HBase replication virtual network diagram

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: **An Azure subscription**.
trans-unit.target: **An Azure subscription**.

trans-unit.source: See [Get Azure free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: See [Get Azure free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: **A workstation with Azure PowerShell**.
trans-unit.target: **A workstation with Azure PowerShell**.

trans-unit.source: See [Install and use Azure PowerShell](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/install-and-use-azure-powershell/).
trans-unit.target: See [Install and use Azure PowerShell](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/install-and-use-azure-powershell/).

trans-unit.source: Before running PowerShell scripts, make sure you are connected to your Azure subscription using the following cmdlet:
trans-unit.target: Before running PowerShell scripts, make sure you are connected to your Azure subscription using the following cmdlet:

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple Azure subscriptions, use the following cmdlet to set the current subscription:
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple Azure subscriptions, use the following cmdlet to set the current subscription:

trans-unit.source: **Two Azure virtual network with VPN connectivity**.
trans-unit.target: **Two Azure virtual network with VPN connectivity**.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Configure a VPN connection between two Azure virtual networks][hdinsight-hbase-geo-replication-vnet].
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Configure a VPN connection between two Azure virtual networks][hdinsight-hbase-geo-replication-vnet].

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Azure service names and virtual machine names must be unique.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Azure service names and virtual machine names must be unique.

trans-unit.source: The name used in this tutorial is Contoso-[Azure Service/VM name]-[EU/US].
trans-unit.target: The name used in this tutorial is Contoso-[Azure Service/VM name]-[EU/US].

trans-unit.source: For example, Contoso-VNet-EU is the Azure virtual network in the North Europe data center; Contoso-DNS-US is the DNS server VM in the East U.S.
trans-unit.target: For example, Contoso-VNet-EU is the Azure virtual network in the North Europe data center; Contoso-DNS-US is the DNS server VM in the East U.S.

trans-unit.source: data center.
trans-unit.target: data center.

trans-unit.source: You must come up with your own names.
trans-unit.target: You must come up with your own names.

trans-unit.source: Create Azure virtual machines to be used as DNS servers
trans-unit.target: Create Azure virtual machines to be used as DNS servers

trans-unit.source: To create a virtual machine within Contoso-VNet-EU, called Contoso-DNS-EU
trans-unit.target: To create a virtual machine within Contoso-VNet-EU, called Contoso-DNS-EU

trans-unit.source: Click **NEW**, **COMPUTE**, **VIRTUAL MACHINE**, **FROM GALLERY**.
trans-unit.target: Click **NEW**, **COMPUTE**, **VIRTUAL MACHINE**, **FROM GALLERY**.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter**.

trans-unit.source: Enter:
trans-unit.target: Enter:

trans-unit.source: **VIRTUAL MACHINE NAME**: Contoso-DNS-EU
trans-unit.target: **VIRTUAL MACHINE NAME**: Contoso-DNS-EU

trans-unit.source: **NEW USER NAME**:
trans-unit.target: **NEW USER NAME**:

trans-unit.source: **NEW PASSWORD**:
trans-unit.target: **NEW PASSWORD**:

trans-unit.source: Enter:
trans-unit.target: Enter:

trans-unit.source: **CLOUD SERVICE**: Create a new cloud service
trans-unit.target: **CLOUD SERVICE**: Create a new cloud service

trans-unit.source: **REGION/AFFINITY GROUP/VIRTUAL NETWORK**: (Select Contoso-VNet-EU)
trans-unit.target: **REGION/AFFINITY GROUP/VIRTUAL NETWORK**: (Select Contoso-VNet-EU)

trans-unit.source: **VIRTUAL NETWORK SUBNETS**: Subnet-1
trans-unit.target: **VIRTUAL NETWORK SUBNETS**: Subnet-1

trans-unit.source: **STORAGE ACCOUNT**: Use an automatically generated storage account
trans-unit.target: **STORAGE ACCOUNT**: Use an automatically generated storage account

trans-unit.source: The cloud service name will be the same as the virtual machine name.
trans-unit.target: The cloud service name will be the same as the virtual machine name.

trans-unit.source: In this case, that is Contoso-DNS-EU.
trans-unit.target: In this case, that is Contoso-DNS-EU.

trans-unit.source: For subsequent virtual machines, I can choose to use the same cloud service.
trans-unit.target: For subsequent virtual machines, I can choose to use the same cloud service.

trans-unit.source: All the virtual machines under the same cloud service share the same virtual network and domain suffix.
trans-unit.target: All the virtual machines under the same cloud service share the same virtual network and domain suffix.

trans-unit.source: The storage account is used to store the virtual machine image file.
trans-unit.target: The storage account is used to store the virtual machine image file.

trans-unit.source: **ENDPOINTS**: (scroll down and select **DNS**)
trans-unit.target: **ENDPOINTS**: (scroll down and select **DNS**)

trans-unit.source: After the virtual machine is created, find out the internal IP and external IP.
trans-unit.target: After the virtual machine is created, find out the internal IP and external IP.

trans-unit.source: Click the virtual machine name, **Contoso-DNS-EU**.
trans-unit.target: Click the virtual machine name, **Contoso-DNS-EU**.

trans-unit.source: Click **DashBoard**.
trans-unit.target: Click **DashBoard**.

trans-unit.source: Write down:
trans-unit.target: Write down:

trans-unit.source: PUBLIC VIRTUAL IP ADDRESS
trans-unit.target: PUBLIC VIRTUAL IP ADDRESS

trans-unit.source: INTERNAL IP ADDRESS
trans-unit.target: INTERNAL IP ADDRESS

trans-unit.source: To create a virtual machine within Contoso-VNet-US, called Contoso-DNS-US
trans-unit.target: To create a virtual machine within Contoso-VNet-US, called Contoso-DNS-US

trans-unit.source: Repeat the same procedure to create a virtual machine with the following values:
trans-unit.target: Repeat the same procedure to create a virtual machine with the following values:

trans-unit.source: VIRTUAL MACHINE NAME: Contoso-DNS-US
trans-unit.target: VIRTUAL MACHINE NAME: Contoso-DNS-US

trans-unit.source: REGION/AFFINITY GROUP/VIRTUAL NETWORK: Select Contoso-VNET-US
trans-unit.target: REGION/AFFINITY GROUP/VIRTUAL NETWORK: Select Contoso-VNET-US

trans-unit.source: VIRTUAL NETWORK SUBNETS: Subnet-1
trans-unit.target: VIRTUAL NETWORK SUBNETS: Subnet-1

trans-unit.source: STORAGE ACCOUNT: Use an automatically generated storage account
trans-unit.target: STORAGE ACCOUNT: Use an automatically generated storage account

trans-unit.source: ENDPOINTS: (select DNS)
trans-unit.target: ENDPOINTS: (select DNS)

trans-unit.source: Set static IP addresses for the two virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Set static IP addresses for the two virtual machines

trans-unit.source: DNS servers requires static IP addresses.
trans-unit.target: DNS servers requires static IP addresses.

trans-unit.source: This step can't be done from the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: This step can't be done from the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: You will use Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: You will use Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: To configure static IP address for the two virtual machines
trans-unit.target: To configure static IP address for the two virtual machines

trans-unit.source: Open Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: Open Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: Run the following cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: Run the following cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: ServiceName is the cloud service name.
trans-unit.target: ServiceName is the cloud service name.

trans-unit.source: Because the DNS server is the first virtual machine of the cloud service, the cloud service name is the same as the virtual machine name.
trans-unit.target: Because the DNS server is the first virtual machine of the cloud service, the cloud service name is the same as the virtual machine name.

trans-unit.source: You might need to update ServiceName and Name to match the names that you have.
trans-unit.target: You might need to update ServiceName and Name to match the names that you have.

trans-unit.source: Add the DNS Server role the two virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Add the DNS Server role the two virtual machines

trans-unit.source: To add the DNS Server role for Contoso-DNS-EU
trans-unit.target: To add the DNS Server role for Contoso-DNS-EU

trans-unit.source: From the Azure portal, click **Virtual Machines** on the left.
trans-unit.target: From the Azure portal, click **Virtual Machines** on the left.

trans-unit.source: Click **Contoso-DNS-EU**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Contoso-DNS-EU**.

trans-unit.source: Click **DASHBOARD** from the top.
trans-unit.target: Click **DASHBOARD** from the top.

trans-unit.source: Click **CONNECT** from the bottom and follow the instructions to connect to the virtual machine via RDP.
trans-unit.target: Click **CONNECT** from the bottom and follow the instructions to connect to the virtual machine via RDP.

trans-unit.source: Within the RDP session, click the Windows button on the bottom left corner to open the Start screen.
trans-unit.target: Within the RDP session, click the Windows button on the bottom left corner to open the Start screen.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Server Manager** tile.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Server Manager** tile.

trans-unit.source: Click **Add Roles and Features**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add Roles and Features**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next**
trans-unit.target: Click **Next**

trans-unit.source: Select **Role-based or feature-based installation**, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Role-based or feature-based installation**, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Select your DNS virtual machine (it shall be highlighted already), and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select your DNS virtual machine (it shall be highlighted already), and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Check **DNS Server**.
trans-unit.target: Check **DNS Server**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Add Features**, and then click **Continue**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add Features**, and then click **Continue**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next** three times, and then click **Install**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next** three times, and then click **Install**.

trans-unit.source: To add the DNS Server role for Contoso-DNS-US
trans-unit.target: To add the DNS Server role for Contoso-DNS-US

trans-unit.source: Repeat the steps to add DNS role to **Contoso-DNS-US**.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the steps to add DNS role to **Contoso-DNS-US**.

trans-unit.source: Assign DNS servers to the virtual networks
trans-unit.target: Assign DNS servers to the virtual networks

trans-unit.source: To register the two DNS servers
trans-unit.target: To register the two DNS servers

trans-unit.source: From the Azure portal, click **NEW**, **NETWORK SERVICES**, **VIRTUAL NETWORK**, **REGISTER DNS SERVER**.
trans-unit.target: From the Azure portal, click **NEW**, **NETWORK SERVICES**, **VIRTUAL NETWORK**, **REGISTER DNS SERVER**.

trans-unit.source: Enter:
trans-unit.target: Enter:

trans-unit.source: **NAME**: Contoso-DNS-EU
trans-unit.target: **NAME**: Contoso-DNS-EU

trans-unit.source: **DNS SERVER IP ADDRESS**: 10.1.0.4 – the IP address must matching the DNS server virtual machine IP address.
trans-unit.target: **DNS SERVER IP ADDRESS**: 10.1.0.4 – the IP address must matching the DNS server virtual machine IP address.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the process to register Contoso-DNS-US with the following settings:
trans-unit.target: Repeat the process to register Contoso-DNS-US with the following settings:

trans-unit.source: **NAME**: Contoso-DNS-US
trans-unit.target: **NAME**: Contoso-DNS-US

trans-unit.source: **DNS SERVER IP ADDRESS**: 10.2.0.4
trans-unit.target: **DNS SERVER IP ADDRESS**: 10.2.0.4

trans-unit.source: To assign the two DNS servers to the two virtual networks
trans-unit.target: To assign the two DNS servers to the two virtual networks

trans-unit.source: Click **Networks** from the left pane in the Management portal.
trans-unit.target: Click **Networks** from the left pane in the Management portal.

trans-unit.source: Click **Contoso-VNet-EU**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Contoso-VNet-EU**.

trans-unit.source: Click **CONFIGURE**.
trans-unit.target: Click **CONFIGURE**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Contoso-DNS-EU** in the **dns servers** section.
trans-unit.target: Select **Contoso-DNS-EU** in the **dns servers** section.

trans-unit.source: Click **SAVE** on the bottom of the page, and click **Yes** to confirm.
trans-unit.target: Click **SAVE** on the bottom of the page, and click **Yes** to confirm.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the process to assign the **Contoso-DNS-US** DNS server to the **Contoso-VNet-US** virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the process to assign the **Contoso-DNS-US** DNS server to the **Contoso-VNet-US** virtual network.

trans-unit.source: All the virtual machines that have been deployed to the virtual networks must be rebooted to update the DNS server configuration.
trans-unit.target: All the virtual machines that have been deployed to the virtual networks must be rebooted to update the DNS server configuration.

trans-unit.source: To reboot the virtual machines
trans-unit.target: To reboot the virtual machines

trans-unit.source: From the Azure portal, click **Virtual Machines** on the left.
trans-unit.target: From the Azure portal, click **Virtual Machines** on the left.

trans-unit.source: Click **Contoso-DNS-EU**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Contoso-DNS-EU**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Dashboard** from the top.
trans-unit.target: Click **Dashboard** from the top.

trans-unit.source: Click **RESTART** on the bottom.
trans-unit.target: Click **RESTART** on the bottom.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the same steps to reboot **Contoso-DNS-US**.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the same steps to reboot **Contoso-DNS-US**.

trans-unit.source: Configure DNS conditional forwarders
trans-unit.target: Configure DNS conditional forwarders

trans-unit.source: The DNS server on each virtual network can only resolve DNS names within that virtual network.
trans-unit.target: The DNS server on each virtual network can only resolve DNS names within that virtual network.

trans-unit.source: You need to configure a conditional forwarder to point to the peer DNS server for name resolutions in the peer virtual network.
trans-unit.target: You need to configure a conditional forwarder to point to the peer DNS server for name resolutions in the peer virtual network.

trans-unit.source: To configure conditional forwarder, you need to know the domain suffixes of the two DNS servers.
trans-unit.target: To configure conditional forwarder, you need to know the domain suffixes of the two DNS servers.

trans-unit.source: The DNS suffixes can be different depending on the Cloud Services configuration you used when you created the virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: The DNS suffixes can be different depending on the Cloud Services configuration you used when you created the virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: For each DNS suffix used in the virtual network, you must add a conditional forwarder.
trans-unit.target: For each DNS suffix used in the virtual network, you must add a conditional forwarder.

trans-unit.source: To find the domain suffixes of the two DNS servers
trans-unit.target: To find the domain suffixes of the two DNS servers

trans-unit.source: RDP into **Contoso-DNS-EU**.
trans-unit.target: RDP into **Contoso-DNS-EU**.

trans-unit.source: Open Windows PowerShell console, or command prompt.
trans-unit.target: Open Windows PowerShell console, or command prompt.

trans-unit.source: Run **ipconfig**, and write down **Connection-specific DNS suffix**.
trans-unit.target: Run **ipconfig**, and write down **Connection-specific DNS suffix**.

trans-unit.source: Do not close the RDP session, you will still need it.
trans-unit.target: Do not close the RDP session, you will still need it.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the same steps to find out the **Connection-specific DNS suffix** of **Contoso-DNS-US**.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the same steps to find out the **Connection-specific DNS suffix** of **Contoso-DNS-US**.

trans-unit.source: To configure DNS forwarders
trans-unit.target: To configure DNS forwarders

trans-unit.source: From the RDP session to **Contoso-DNS-EU**, click the Windows key on the lower left.
trans-unit.target: From the RDP session to **Contoso-DNS-EU**, click the Windows key on the lower left.

trans-unit.source: Click **Administrative Tools**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Administrative Tools**.

trans-unit.source: Click **DNS**.
trans-unit.target: Click **DNS**.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, expand **DSN**, **Contoso-DNS-EU**.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, expand **DSN**, **Contoso-DNS-EU**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following information:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following information:

trans-unit.source: **DNS Domain**: enter the DNS suffix of the Contoso-DNS-US.
trans-unit.target: **DNS Domain**: enter the DNS suffix of the Contoso-DNS-US.

trans-unit.source: For example: Contoso-DNS-US.b5.internal.cloudapp.net.
trans-unit.target: For example: Contoso-DNS-US.b5.internal.cloudapp.net.

trans-unit.source: **IP addresses of the master servers**: enter 10.2.0.4, which is the Contoso-DNS-US’s IP address.
trans-unit.target: **IP addresses of the master servers**: enter 10.2.0.4, which is the Contoso-DNS-US’s IP address.

trans-unit.source: Press **ENTER**, and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Press **ENTER**, and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Now you will be able to resolve the Contoso-DNS-US’s IP address from Contoso-DNS-EU.
trans-unit.target: Now you will be able to resolve the Contoso-DNS-US’s IP address from Contoso-DNS-EU.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the steps to add a DNS forwarder to the DNS service on the Contoso-DNS-US virtual machine with the following values:
trans-unit.target: Repeat the steps to add a DNS forwarder to the DNS service on the Contoso-DNS-US virtual machine with the following values:

trans-unit.source: **DNS Domain**: enter the DNS suffix of the Contoso-DNS-EU.
trans-unit.target: **DNS Domain**: enter the DNS suffix of the Contoso-DNS-EU.

trans-unit.source: **IP addresses of the master servers**: enter 10.2.0.4, which is the Contoso-DNS-EU’s IP address.
trans-unit.target: **IP addresses of the master servers**: enter 10.2.0.4, which is the Contoso-DNS-EU’s IP address.

trans-unit.source: Test the name resolution across the virtual networks
trans-unit.target: Test the name resolution across the virtual networks

trans-unit.source: Now you can test host name resolution across the virtual networks.
trans-unit.target: Now you can test host name resolution across the virtual networks.

trans-unit.source: Ping is blocked by firewall by default.
trans-unit.target: Ping is blocked by firewall by default.

trans-unit.source: You can use nslookup to resolve the DNS server virtual machines (you must use FQDN) in the peer networks.
trans-unit.target: You can use nslookup to resolve the DNS server virtual machines (you must use FQDN) in the peer networks.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you have learned how to configure name resolution across virtual networks with VPN connections.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you have learned how to configure name resolution across virtual networks with VPN connections.

trans-unit.source: The other two articles in the series cover:
trans-unit.target: The other two articles in the series cover:

trans-unit.source: Configure a VPN connection between two Azure virtual networks
trans-unit.target: Configure a VPN connection between two Azure virtual networks

trans-unit.target: Configure HBase geo replication

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
